name: Dominic Owino
comment:
We have a mobile app project and we would like the following details from a potential app development firm:

1. Design, Development & Delivery Process: We would like to understand how your firm will engage with our team during the design, dev and testing phase.
2. Skills / Expertise: Whereas we have our requirements and design specifications done, we would like the person/team that will be engaging with us counter-propose better alternatives where they exist - i.e. we would like to work with a developer who will not only code our app but fully understand our goals and propose better ways of delivering them where we have not considered some approaches.
3. Technology choice: Initially we plan to release this app on android only, but after 2 months of pilot we will consider developing across other platforms (IOS and maybe windows), we have been considering using xamarin for cross-platform development - what are your thoughts (should we consider this choice) and will you be able to support us with this framework?
4. Confidentiality: Due to the nature of our business - we would not want the name of our firm or mobile app to be referenced by your company without prior consent from our company.
5. Charging & Pricing: What is your charging model?
6. Integrated team: We plan to have 2 of our internal developers work with 1 developer from your firm on this project - how will this collaboration work? We see the developer from your firm being the lead developer on the project and assisted by our 2 developers (we can assign 1 more developer if the effort estimates suggest so).
7. Effort estimation & Extra Costs: What happens if the effort is underestimated?
8. Quotation & Timelines: Based on the following high-level features:
The App is a bill presentment and payment app in the first iteration. The main app features are:
	(a) Bill presentment by reading SMS's and / or push notifications. Bills are presented in an inbox style and tinder-like cards with pay options.
	(b) Bill payments by Card, Mobile Money (USSD Push or STK invocation) via our payment gateway.
	(c) Management of Merchants and Stores of Value (Banks, Cards, Mobile Money). Add, edit, activate and deactivate actions.
	(d) Summaries dashboards and charts.
	(e) Push notification actions comprising pay, dismiss, and snooze.
	
First iteration is bill payment with subsequent iterations including budgeting, peer-to-peer payments, scheduled bill payments among others.

The detailed design and requirements documentation will be shared upon providing the above information and an NDA - Please share with us the development quotations and timelines to a complete release.

Regards,

name: Austin Graham
comment:
Hello,

I serve a marketing position for a hotel group. Please take a look at my idea and see if you can help.

I plan to create an app/website that allows hotel properties and users connect directly. Ultimately, the goal is to cut out the middleman in our online bookings (priceline.com, Expedia.com.)

Our site should be simple to use and function similar to craigslist. The main difference is that our site needs to allow for excess rooms to be listed across different dates, and for different prices. Our site will not process payments or allow the consumer to actually book a room. The users will simply be directed to book with the hotel directly once they find a price and room they are pleased with.

For the property owner who wishes to list her property on our site, they should have access to their own profile that they can edit, upload photos, a description of their property ,amenities, contact info, and post their price for respective dates and room types (similar to craigslist, I will provide no support to the properties who choose to use the site.)

When travelers access our site, I want them to have a seamless experience. Simplicity is important. The top of the home page should display two links at the top: About us, List a Property. In the middle of the page, visitors should see a search bar that has letters to the left side "Where are you going?" Upon clicking the search bar they will access a key letter recognizing system that will assist them in finding their city of interest. Immediately to the right of this search bar, two boxes should be present for Arrival and Departure dates. These boxes should produce a calendar when clicked. The user should be able to imply cruise through the calendar and select the dates they are interested in.

Most importantly, our site should be easily found in search engine searches. I am very unfamiliar with this industry, I hope you can help me understand how we can effectively build this site and show up in searches.

Please contact me if you are interested in working with our group.

Thank you,


Austin Graham

name: Matthew Clifton
comment:
Zoo Aquarium Association Mobile App:
	
Goal:

•	Create a mobile app with access to contact details of all ZAA members
•	Easy to use interface for all members to use GPS to find local members/ institutions

Rough design:

•	Concept is very similar to GeoCaching – people use location to find institution etc.
•	Connectivity is very similar to TeamApp > ability to create events, send out notifications, message etc

Zoo Aquarium Association Mobile App:

Goal: Create a mobile app for members to find other members and their contact details via search bar (containing names, institutions, locations) or GPS location

Concept: 
- Members download app, create a profile based on their role - they can join an institution. Ideally people can search for their name under an institution.
- Once all members have created profiles, using your location or search bar, you can find other members nearby > this is useful for when veterinary officers or policy managers need to travel to different states to discuss programs, they can sign in, and find the nearest contact etc.

Starting point:
- Map all institutions on Map of Australasia region
- Members sign in and allocate themselves to an institution
- additional member signs in, searches for institution and finds local contact

Additional information:
- Have a generic homepage with map of Australasia with search bar at top
- Have events section, so institutions can log event where they can invite members
- Have a messages sections so other members can inbox other members
- Have a notifications centre

name: Gary Johnson
comment:

name: Nabeel Turki
comment:
ShoSayerJo Mobile Application

This app will be offered/promoted to the Jordanian community to download whereby people will be able to view the latest offers by the different companies/brands in the market.

1.	System Requirements
i.	Registration: People that have downloaded the mobile app will be added onto a membership database.
ii.	Interests: Upon registering, people will be able to select their interests either by categories and/or brands.

2.	Database Driven System
i.	App Management: The database driven system will enable ShoSayerJo’s team to upload promotions from different brands. 
ii.	Google Maps: The ShoSayerJo team should be able to add a brand’s location or locations using Google Maps. This will also with the sending of automatic Geographical Push Notifications which are discussed below in point number 5.
iii.	Mobile Responsive: Promotions that have been uploaded should contain an image of a standard size that is suitable for mobile screens in addition to up to 6 lines of text that any part of which can also be link-able to a website or Social Media Page.

3.	System Output 
i.	Main/Front Page: This page should contain a picture that will contain the highlights of the day in text format in addition to a button that will take them to page 2 which will be an index of the categories for all of the promotions within the app.
Example: Automotive, Electronics, Fashion, etc.
ii.	Index Page: All of the categories should be link-able to the listing of the selected category.
iv.	Category Page: Should contain all of the promotions available for that category; each promotion should contain the standard size image along with up to 6 lines of text that any part of which can also be link-able to a website or Social Media Page.
v.	Brand Page: Should contain all of the promotions available for that brand; each promotion should contain the standard size image along with up to 6 lines of text that any part of which can also be link-able to a website or Social Media Page.
iii.	Back Button: Each page should have a back button or arrow on top of the page in order to return to the previous page.
iv.	Social Network Login: Consumers must login to the app with their social media pages such as Facebook, Twitter, etc.

4.	Mobile Operating Systems
i.	App should be built to work on all mobile operating systems such as iOS, Android, Windows, etc.

5.	Automatic Push Notifications
i.	Automatic New Offer Push Notification: Send push notifications to customers automatically, informing them of a new offer available to them according to their interests and/or brands they follow.
ii.	Automatic Geographical Push Notification: Send an automatic push notification of a brand of interest or interest of the customer to customers if they’re within “X” proximity of the brand’s location; informing them of the current available offer.

name: Danhelson Chua
comment:
Hi there,

I am an Australian entrepreneur who is currently scouting for the most suitable developer for a product that we are incubating. Our target market is initially within Australia, but in due time we intend to roll this out internationally. As such we are looking for a partner who is willing to work with us from Proof of Concept way up to large-scale Market deployment stages. We appreciate a technical team that understands our vision and what we are trying to achieve, and make this happen with the best possible quality.

Our high level requirement is to build a trusted online/mobile platform that makes it incredibly easy to connect teachers and students by offering social networking features, a booking and payment management facility, ‘credibility and trust’ profiles (e.g., user testimonials and reviews), geo-mapping, and  content sharing.

If you have a look at this Indian website, it looks very similar to what we are trying to build in Australia, albeit at a more sophisticated scale and more features offfered: http://www.getprofessor.com/

End state is a top performing website and accompanying mobile applications.

However, we require someone who is willing to work with us in an incremental fashion (Agile), who is open to committing to short-term contracts, which we will continually renew as we gradually see the product come to life.

Having said all these, can you please send me your evaluation (along with financial quotations) on:

1. Building a Proof of Concept/prototype that we can use to test with our market
2. Building a working website for our initial launch
3. Building accompanying iOS and Android apps 
4. Continuous enhancements/changes/support

I have read your company's profile and I'm thoroughly impressed with how you presented yourself. As such, I am genuinely thrilled to hearing from you a reasonable yet promising feedback.

Regards,
Dan

name: John Mahan
comment:
Functional Requirements

Talisman LLC is the first-of-its kind hookah home delivery service in NYC, allowing users to enjoy high-quality hookahs at their homes. Users will find us through online channels or speak with call-center representatives (the reps will then place orders on customer’s behalf through the website). 

Since, we are not a brick-and-mortar business, having strong online brand presence and intuitive and user-friendly web interface is critical to our success. 
This document describes requirements of hookah home delivery service, and the desired features for the mobile friendly website and Mobile Apps for Android and iOS. 
Geo location  tracking and Service information
Allow user to use GPS tracker to provide their location information, and auto-populate zipcode, city, and state and street for ordering purposes 
Allows uses to know if whether they are in coverage. If in coverage, the user sees a welcome message with  a menu.
If out of coverage, the user is notified ‘service not available’ message and asked  to input email to be notified of service expansion in future - should make it clear that this is an NYC only product when downloaded (for now).. Don’t want a lot of people downloading in other states/countries only to be disappointed
Menu screen
The menu shows up as a compact, intuitive menu to display product type and how it works. Using picture icons and minimal text. Description provided upon user selection for more info.
Upon selecting the hookah, the menu expands / goes to the flavors option. The user selects the flavor and quantity. 
Upon  selection of flavor the user is given combination of selecting the add-ons.
Add-ons 
The Add-ons include: Hookah setup option, Extra flavor-tops, and multi-day rental options. These options may change as business needs evolve
Order placement 
User is asked  to fill out form to enter the delivery address, phone, emails  and any other  special  instruction that they need  to submit
The user selects the date and time of delivery. The earliest delivery time available is 2 (configurable) hours from the time of order. The hours may be dynamically updated based on demand and available inventory, or manually configured by the Admin. The availability should be able to adjust to the work load and/or any bottlenecks. 
The delivery times are only available for 5 PM – 1 AM (configurable by Admin)
The user selects the Hookah pick-up time in the same manner as delivery time. The pickups are also in a certain window (12 PM – 5 PM for example), and dynamically updated based on availability of delivery personnel
Payment Methods: 
Upon selecting desired delivery/pickup times user clicks checkout
User provide credit card information and clicks submit. 
User has the option of using Apple-Pay, Google Wallet, PayPal and stripe, plus Any other means to make payment as seamless and convenient as possible
Terms and Conditions
User is displayed legal notice regarding age, harms of tobacco required to be reported by the law 
User is provided with terms of service and limited liability coverage by the insurance in case of breakage or damage to the product.
User agrees  for Terms and  Conditions
Cancellation policy page + options for cancellation and request of refunds
Order Notifications
Upon successful payment transaction the user receives  payment receipt. alongwith a tracking link in case they change their mind and want to cancel 
User should be able to track, manage, and  cancel the order on website/  within the app
The user gets a confirmation when the order has been dispatched with ETA of delivery 
The user gets a confirmation/ reminder of hookah pick up 1 hr before the scheduled pick up
A real-time delivery tracking option for hookah delivery/ pickup is also desirable. 
Rating and reviews
Post-service survey option to user after they return hookah. 
Ability to like us on Facebook, follow on twitter, post on any social media platform regarding their experience 
A contact-us section to provide feedback, request refunds etc.
User registration 
In order to make frequent ordering easier and seamless, users will be provided the option to register to the website, or check out as guests. 
User will be provide the option to login using Facebook, Google+, Linkedin 
The user registration should be as seamless as possible. Instead of confirmation emails, the user should be able to provide password and email and become registered instantly.
Suggestions
Use a map Uber-style for real-time tracking 
Allow user to select the date and time (in 1-hour windows) to get the hookah’s delivered
Subscription based model: Allow user to get hookahs at regularly (every week for example). User can select the regular interval gap in number of days/ weeks.
Allow user to get an assistant (a person) to change the coals
Rank product/ flavors based on most popular flavors / trending/ today’s special etc 
A static guide (how-to) on Talisman hookahs and service (how to use)
Out of stock notification for hookahs to admin, auto-update of available inventory.
Email and Text to user when the stock arrives
Special offers for frequent customers
Refer a friend promo (get $5 off next order if you refer a friend and their friend gets a $5 off as well - we should have serious referral fees, like $100 to promote growth initially, “loss leader” product pricing). 
 Call-center integration for more scalable operation 
Tulio SMS integration for text notifications
Auto-ingest of orders to partner sites or APIs (delivery systems, Order management systems)

name: Peter Moore
comment:
We need a hybrid app developed for iPhone and Android as follows.

The purpose of the app is to "prove" to a child that Santa Claus was in their house on Christmas eve.

1) A user takes a 10-15 second video with their phone.  This will be a video with the camera being held still and filming the same place.

2) We will pre-record (on a green screen) videos of Santa Claus doing and saying various actions.  The user can then choose on of the pre-recorded videos and merge it into the video they took to make it appear as if Santa Claus was actually in their original video.

3) The user should be able so scale the size, and lighting of the pre-recorded video to make it match the scale and lighting of the video they recorded.

There is a VERY similar app on the market already.  It is called Kringl ( https://itunes.apple.com/ca/app/kringl-proof-santa-video-app/id766244627?mt=8 ) , and can be used for reference.  The only difference between our app and Kringl will be the scenes with the Santa Claus will be different.

name: Milad Aria
comment:
Hello

We have a food ordering system that consists of a customer mobile app on iPhone and a merchant app on iPad that is installed in the restaurant. Order is placed through the iPhone and shows up in the restaurant on the iPad. We have a backend for Admin to enter restaurant information and for Business to enter the menu. 

First step after signing NDA and Non-compete we will give you all the source code for you to set it up in your environment and then update, debug and optimize apps with latest coding practices and standards and so everything works flawlessly with iOS 9 on iPhone and iPad, some of the items that we have identified are the following: 

-	Current BrainTree SDK version 3.7.1  for payment module is not compatible with xcode 7 (iOS 9.0). So, we need to upgrade this SDK version to 3.9.4
-	Upgrade of the source code targets to point to the latest iOS SDK.
-	Estimote SDK version upgrade from 2.2.1 to latest 3.7.1
-	All the web services will have to be updated to https protocol as this is mandatory for IOS 9 security policies.
-	Objective C syntax update across the board and include changes to take advantage of Apple's new Bit code optimization model.

Please provide the following:
1. Your feedback on how you would accomplish this
2. Approximate timeline and steps needed for this to be done
3. Approximate costs 
4. Your skype and email address 

If this job is done successfully there is opportunity for ongoing work as we have a lot of features to be added such as loyalty program, incentive program and lot more and ongoing maintenance that needs to be done. Right now we are on budget before we get funded so we are looking for affordable yet high quality and reliable solution. 

Please contact me if you are interested in this project so we could move forward as soon as possible. 

Thank you,
Milad

comment:
I am opening a yoga studio in Phoenix, Arizona, United States. I am a professional web developer and will create the website. I am looking for a company to develop both an iOS and Android app for my studio.

Once we figure out the details, I will design the look and feel of the app in Photoshop. I will give you a JPG of every page and every action on the app. You would then need to code the functionality.

Website is coded in ruby on rails with a MySQL database. The app needs to communicate back and forth with the website, and I can create any kind of API you need.

The app will:

1. Have a user login / registration

2. Login is email + password. App should allow touchID login instead of typing the password.

3. Registration is first name, last name, email, password, phone number (US only). Optional picture. Optional credit card information.

4. Push notifications

5. Schedule section that lists classes by day. All schedule info must be pulled from the website.

6. QR code or similar that is unique to each user. This code can be scanned off their phone as they walk into the studio to identify them. The app just needs to be able to display the code.

Please let me know your thoughts, and how much you estimate this will cost to create. Thank you,

Patrick

name: Nick
comment:
Summary:
An iOS app to recreate a local shopping experience for consumers in developing markets. The aim of this app is to bring brands and consumers in emerging markets closer by offering an app that facilitates cross border e-commerce in a manner that allows the consumer and brand to have a more in-depth relationship than simple transactional commerce. This app will initially focus on the Chinese market. Translation will be handled by another party. 

Time frame:
•	Development Partner Selection – December 30th 2015
•	Project Kick Off 2016 Q1

Background:
I believe in being transparent so here is a little background information on myself and the project. I am a British national currently based in the UK with experience working in China in the realms of e-commerce, fashion and investment. I was previously due to start work on a VC backed e-commerce company but due to issues with the Chinese VC this had to be shelved. For this project, I have currently received initial interest from contacts in the Chinese investment industry and have been asked to move to develop the idea further before seeking to finalize a pre-seed investment in Q1 next year. 

Key Features:
•	Browse brands and products based on personal likes (as defined by answers to questions in app install), country of origin, style, type (up coming designer, trending, luxury etc) etc. 
•	Understand the brand: individual brand pages with embedded media (including video), upcoming events (user can click to add to calendar), text description and products.
•	Purchase and track products within the app. 
•	Share - including post purchase incentive based social sharing
•	In app premium membership purchase 
•	Social video feature allowing viewers to comment live (see apps such as periscope) during the video. Understand possibility of integrating product tags in-video so whilst we’re interviewing a brand about their products, viewers get a pop up tag which links directly to the product in our app. 

Key Menu Items (provisional)
•	Home
•	Discover
•	Live Streams
•	Saved Shops
•	Wish List
•	Recently Viewed
•	Your Account
•	Your Orders 
•	Settings

Key Integrations:
•	Payment, Logistics & Customer Service. This will be handled by our local partner but support will need to be given to implement this. 
•	Analytics – App Annie
•	Marketing – email, social media integration 

What I Need:
•	Please send me an approximate development cost (ideally based on differing levels of development maturity – UX, Test Stage, Launch Stage.
•	Your development process
•	Models of engagement/service package
•	Any relevant case studies
•	Further information on your business.

A technology solution providing a hassle-free delivery and pick up service for customers.  The simple to use and convenient service will bridge the gap between customers and their needs and wants. This project (name yet to be decided) will facilitate the delivery or pick from any restaurant or store within one hour upon request. 

Users will place a delivery order for pick up from any restaurant or store in Doha, Qatar. Drivers will then be matched with the customer, go to the restaurant or store, pick up the food or item and deliver it to the customer. Again, this will be completed in one hour or less.

All drivers must be 18+ years of age, own a car, motorcycle, truck or scooter and have a valid driver's license. Upon applying for a position, the driver will then go through a background check. 

Drivers can conduct any job at their own convenience and set their own hours of work. In terms of financial compensation, drivers will receive a certain percentage of the delivery fee and 100% of the tip. The project company will receive a processing fee of the delivery (processing fee to be determined).

Are you going on vacation? is the expenses for the plane ticket or theme park alone going to be crazy? why not use StorMe to see what houses in that area are having short term room rentals? Do you have excess furniture? is your garage full and you don't want to pay ridiculous money for a storage unit? why not use StorMe? StorMe is a simple App willing to connect people looking to either save money or make money. Are you worried about your stored items? Don't worry! every city we expand to will have managers on the ground to ensure your property is safe and secure!
 
So a little more detail on the app.  It will be FREE to all ALWAYS. you login into the app and choose whether you want to find a room or to find storage. you then type the zip code for the area you are looking for. a map then shows with blips on potential houses willing to rent their property space. you click on the blip and it shows you details, prices monthly or nightly and pictures of the house.  you choose that house and the owner gets notified via the App they see your details and your rating and they approve you. you then choose how many nights you wish to stay and pay via the app.
Storage is a little different because its long term monthly not short term nightly so its all dependent on what you want to do.

name: Abdelaziz Farraj
comment:
Dear Openxcell Team,

I hope this email finds you well. I have an app idea which I'm wondering if Openxcell can create for me. I'm planning to establish a delivery business that makes it easier for people to send and receive items without the hassle of giving out addresses verbally. I simply want an app that facilitates the process between my drivers and customers, making the whole process as easy, enjoyable and accurate as possible.

- How do current delivery businesses work in Saudi Arabia?
Everything is done manually. People communicate their addresses manually and verbally. Items get lost. Drivers get lost. Drivers forget addresses, and get confused. Customers are not able to track their items. 

- How do I want my business to work?
my planned business consists of: Cars, Drivers, Customers. I don't want any of them to communicate verbally or manually. I want the app to do everything. Via the app the customers will schedule a delivery and locate their location. Via the app the drivers will get notified about the delivery orders and can drive to customers addresses using the navigation system. Via the app customers will track their items. Everything will start and end through the app.


- What do I want?
I would like an app that allows a customer to register and send an item, and locate his location via the app and send it to the driver. The customer should put the receiver mobile number and name. Once the sender completes the process, the receiver will get SMS with a link requiring him to download the app and locate his location and choose date and time of drop off. 

Here is how I imagine the app:
1- The sender log in to the app and clicks a button to send an item.
2- The sender will be required to locate his location and fill in information about the item such as content, size, time and date of pick up, then he should type the receiver name and mobile number, then he sends the item.
3- The receiver will get SMS on his phone with a link requiring him to download the app to locate his location and time and date of delivery, then confirms the process.
4- The driver will get a notification about the order, including the sender location and the receiver location, and other details.
5- The driver can drive to the customers address using the navigation system.
6- Both the sender and the receiver can track the item.

I'd greatly appreciate getting back to me regarding the app, and I hope your answer will cover the following points:
- Cost of developing, designing, servicing and maintaining the app for both iOS & Android.
- Time needed to fully finish the project.

Please don't hesitate to contact me should you have any question.

Best regards,
Abdelaziz
Mobile: +966562228786

name: Aditya Sharma
comment:
Sr.	Requirement Outline
1	"Objective
To create a mobile device learning & assessment platform that can be used by Channelplay for training field force of its various clients.
2	System Structure
-A Mobile App that acts as the frontend where users can login and attempt courses
-An Admin Panel accessible by laptop which will be used for user management, course management and downloading reports"
3	"Technical Requirement
-App compatibility with Android & IOS platform
-App must run on 2G
-Offline access to courses & assessment sync
-Login device tracking
-It must have a functionality which allows it to be used for various clients"
4	"User Registration
-User account created from the Admin Panel
-Data required - User's email id, employee code, company name, region, state/city
-Username & password emailed to the user once the account created from backend"
5	"Login
-User downloads the app, enters the username & password to login
-User has option to change password post first login
-Forgot password functionality on login page"
6	"Homepage
My Dashboard-
My Progress - Pending courses, Completed courses, Not Started
Announcement tab - Displays announcements from admin, notifications about posting of new course etc. 
Help tab - Allows the user to send a text message (feedback/query) to the admin & track status of queries"
7	"Content
-A course can be in the form of PDF, Word, PowerPoint, Video or a combination of these 
-Each course will have an assessment composed of multiple choice questions, fill in the blanks, true/false, match the following
-A 5 pointer quick survey after each course for user feedback on the course
-Course content should get downloaded on the app only when user chooses to do a course
-Offline access to course material is a must
-Course progress should get saved wherever the user leaves the course
-Course status / results of assessments completed offline should sync quickly when connected to internet"
8	"Backend requirements (Backend interface should be accessible on laptop)
-Course Management --> course creation, assessment creation, course assignment
-User Management --> user creation, deletion, batch creation
-Notification Section --> here the admin can control the notifications sent to the user, custom notifications functionality
-Survey Section --> Here the post course survey can be created
-Helpdesk Section --> where admin can respond to user queries
-Reports Section --> Course wise Participation Report, Performance Report, Survey Report"

name: Richard Tang
comment:
Hello,

Me and my business partner have an app idea and we are currently looking for a development company.

Think of this app as uber, but for everything else besides ride sharing. 

The app (no name has been given yet) aims to help people find other people in their area who are willing to perform a small job for a tip. The app is similar to TaskRabbit (www.taskrabbit.com), however,

·        The jobs posted do not have to fall into a predefined category

·        Most of the jobs posted in the app follow a theme where the task does not require previous experience or training.

·        Fixed payment rather than pay per hour.

 In addition to larger areas accessible by cars, we feel the app can also grow in smaller communities, such as on a college campus, where most gigs does not require a car. So in summary, whereas TaskRabbit connects users to professionals for more formal jobs, our app connects users to users for all kind of jobs. The job can be local or online, however, users can only accept jobs within a certain distance; even for online jobs. We will monetize the app by taking a percentage of the total transaction.  

Here is the simplified process: 
1) Someone posts a small one time job 
2) Another user takes the job. Job disappear on job listing, to prevent multiple task takers. 
3) Helper finishes the job. Poster's predeposited payment transfer to helper if no problems are reported.  

Some requirements: 

• Liquid payment processor. Currently, our largest obstacle is finding the right way to process payments. Some jobs like food delivery will require the poster to deposit the cost of the goods in addition to the helper's tip. This mean once a payment has been made, the funds will need the ability to move from one user to the other. 

• User Database. Create account/Facebook log-in. Each phone can only create one account. 

• User rating after transaction. No comments needed, just a number that averages into the helper's average rating. 

• Show available jobs in local area by list new, view by catagory or on a map (using Google Map API) 

• A way to show statics on traffic and transaction in the back end for us. No need to be UX friendly.  
Please give me an estimate on 3 different prices: IOS, android, mobile Web app. 

No conversion will be talking place in the app as the app will provide cell phone numbers / contact info with the poster and the help.

Here are some mockup for the app, just to show the some of the contents. Don't take the UI and placement seriously. https://www.dropbox.com/sh/xpi0gifulxx9kb7/AAD3Qy6vH9CdkQCY1B9hijsxa?dl=0

That's a quick summary of the app, please give me a estimate. Let me know if you have any questions. You can reach me at 1.312.927.2684 anytime from 4:15 PM - 9 PM CST 

Thanks,
Richard Tang

name: Mohammed Hanbal
comment:
Good Morning Team Openxcell,

My Name is Mohammed Hanbal and I have an idea for an iOS app and was wondering if you be able to help design and develop it. It may sound like a simple app but I am sure the coding and programming could take some time

The iOS app should do the following:

1. UserA launches the app and types in a message (i.e. looking for coldplay concert tickets)

2. This messages gets pushed/sent to all the other users who are subscribed under category (Music Concerts/Tickets)

3. Lets say 50 Users received this message. Only two were interested in replying

4. User B and User C will then reply to original message sent by UserA

5. User A will then continue chatting with Users B and C individually (two separate conversations)

So basically, once User A launches the app, all he has to do is send a message and sit back. All the other users registered within the application (under certain categories) will receive this message and reply.

Think about the "broadcast" feature built into WhatsApp. Except that you don't have a broadcast list. You just broadcast your message to all the other users in the App.

Think of also Facebook M. 



Thanks in advance for your reply. Looking forward to hearing back from you

P.S. We are a small startup and would like to know what is a realistic budget and timeline for this project. We can start with a quote for just a prototype

Our site is MedicalTravelDirect.com. We are a membership club. Our members pay a low annual fee (or corp memberships) to get access to our carefully screened providers (health care, hotels, restaurants, tour operators, etc) who provide our Members a discount because 1. We do not charge them any advertising fees or commissions to refer patients/guests - so they save 15 to 20 %....2. With our system, they get an email from our Member with the Member´s name, email and phone number so they can contact them directly and close the deal....no intermediaries.

We would like to copy our existing site and modify it to be a discount travel and entertainment site (eliminate the medical part).

A critical feature for our apps would be ¨learning¨our Members preferences. When they register, they go through a set up where they indicate their favourites. When our Providers register their hotels, restaurants, etc, they would also go through a set up to check certain features which would be used to match their business with our Members´preferences...e.g. price, quality, type of food...this would require a modification to our websites...so that when the Member selects a city where they live or are going to visit, the app gives them their preference choices first..saving time.

Some of our providers simply provide a discount or special offers in their mini-site. Only paying Members can see the discounts. Others have us set up with travel agency rates with a promotion code which they use to make the reservation in the hotel reservation system. Again, they can only see the promotional code when they are a paying member.

Members do not make their reservations through us...they contact the provider and book the appointment or reservation.

Providers know a person is a member by the member presenting their membership card with expiration date or on the home page (once they are a Provider), they can use the Member Look Up.

Need a quote for the above.

Thanks. I travel a lot so email is best.

William Schwind
President
MedicalTravelDirect.com

name: David Shirley
comment:
Greetings,
I am looking to transform an SMS based Communications / Grievance System we use with Adidas and garment factory workers into an Android App.
Essentially, what we already have, is the workflow and requirements. This previously worked as an SMS gateway deployed in a factory. Through which, factory management can disseminate best practices to their workers and HR policy updates. The receiving aspect allowed grievances from factory workers. This information was then categorized based on key words into categories and produce weekly / monthly graphs. High-risk issues would be auto-forwarded by email. 
This is the information on the SMS system and our expansion to date
http://blog.adidas-group.com/2015/04/how-we-bring-factory-management-and-workers-closer-together/
We would like the app to be deployed per factory, in other words, not available on a public store. We would sell the app to each factory, and the number of installations is based on their workforce. E.g., if we sell this to a Factory with 3000 workers, we could charge $1 per license per worker, either one time or reoccurring.  Each deployment would then be on a factory to factory basis.
In terms of the workflow and requirements, I think we have that pretty clear and my team can share that all with you.

We recently won the Palladium: Make is possible initiative to transform this idea into an android app.
http://thepalladiumgroup.com/knowledge/make-it-possible-initiative-winners

Please get in touch and we can discussing pricing to make this happen.

Thanks,
David Shirley
Springfields

name: Usama Zaid
comment:
Aesthetic Play Website Web Application Optimization

Web Application:  https://aestheticplay.com/ 

My name is Usama Zaid and I am the director of E Cloud Trainers Inc. that operates aestheticplay.com.

We recently launched our application in September and since then had major issues with deployment.  Our website crashed due to improper server configuration’s. We made changes on the server and application side to rectify the issue. But in the process did not find out what was consuming ram resources. Currently our server is massive with 64GB ram and 16 vCPU from AWS (which is overkill) and is holding steady. I do not trust my current company to rectify any issues that may be there on the application side.

Our application is based off Wordpress and PHP. Many custom plugins were created to solve the needs of my business. 

My application is subscription based E-learning website. Our trainers create online courses that people can buy into and get access for a period of time.  Our courses are accessed through videos and other documents. 

Requirements

My requirements are very specific for this project. I require a senior PHP developer that has expertise in MySQL. 

•	Need to conduct load testing for 2000 concurrent users 
•	Proper configuration of server using AWS
•	Database analysis to optimize request times and bottlenecks 
•	Possible implementation of Nginx , Varnish , mem cache, APC for PHP, Yepnope if required, , Optimizely, CDN, fancy box, max & min width, device pixel ratio, CrazyEgg,  user friendly analytics tools (server side and application side) and  other suggestions are welcome 
o	Need comparison technologies used by udemy.com , dressyourfacelive.com and ghalichiglam.com that can be implemented to optimize my website 
o	These companies are in the same business, especially the last 2 
•	Memory leaks, apache process requests, indexing, queries, compilations and recompilations, JS requests, Caching, full application profiling (including database required) , Image compression , JS and CSS minify , server response time reduction , render blocking JS, database table
•	Proper Google analytics implantation 
•	Security and encryption for application if needed 

The above is a summery of the scope of what I require and further suggestions are welcome, wherever needed. I am looking for complete troubleshooting of application (including database) and optimization that would improve application scalability efficiently with minimum resource use. 

Unfortunately due to my previous experiences I am very ridged when it comes to timeline and implementation of functions and tools. Possibly need of a developer for PHP, server side expert and project manager. 

Further I have my current team on standby for major issues on the application that they can fix as included in the project scope by them.

Initially I would like a full overview of issues on application side and possible solutions to rectify and further optimize.

There are about 20-30 hours of work required for some minor changes in the website. 

Another issue we had when we launched our first course was that about 150/1500 people did not get access to the course when they signed up and paid through PayPal and/or Stripe. We had to manually add these users from the back end. 

This project by no means is a one-time endeavor; I require solid company/team that can help my business grow. We will be further expanding to application development in the coming months. 

Time line is of major concern, as we need to deploy further courses and have clients waiting. 

Please provide the estimate of cost and timeline for such a project. 

Sincerely, 
Usama Zaid 
Director of E Cloud Trainers Inc.

name: DAVID ELI MONTOYA
comment:
We intend to create an app that uses the text and GPS functions of the android device. This app will look and function like a calculator app that is found on every phone/watch out there. When a certain codes are punched in the app will do the follow:
Code 1: open a menu where the user can input up to 10 numbers on their emergency contact list. The menu will also let the user choose the frequency of time between pings to the contacts (1,2 and 5 min options), and what message they want to send (less then 200 characters)
Code 2: 911 alert that sends a message and a Lat/Long grid to all the contacts on the emergency contact list every 1-5 min. 
Code 3: Terminate the 911 alert by sending an all Clear message to the contact list
The app will run in the background, it will also have a 911 function by pressing a combination of 2 buttons or holding a certain button or area for a certain number of seconds (volume up and main button for 3 seconds would trigger the 911 alert without going into the app)
The app will not need mobile data, it will pull the GPS coordinate and then send it via text. It will only need a cell phone signal and GPS satellite lock.

name: Rob Shujman
comment:
Request for Proposals

We are seeking bids for development of a mobile cosmetic medical services delivery company application for iPhone iOS.  The functionality we require is:

1.	Scheduling
a.	We envision this via 2 individual apps
i.	Customer facing
1.	Customers will be able to schedule an appointment via the app
2.	Customers will be able to see prior history of appointments
ii.	Medical Service Provider facing
1.	Service Provider will be able to confirm appointment
2.	Service Provider  will be able to see calendar/schedule of upcoming appointments
3.	Service Provider will be able to set as en route to appointment
4.	Service Provider will be able to see details of appointments (procedures, location, etc)
2.	Real-time GPS position tracking viewable by Customer
a.	Service Provider’s position should be able to be viewed by Customer with approximate estimated time of arrival when Service Provider is en route to their specific appointment
3.	Credit card payment availability
a.	Credit card payment through Square
4.	Customer medical consent form and basic medical history
a.	This information needs to be entered by Customer and confirmed by Service Provider
5.	Backend Customer analytics to track the value of each Customer
a.	Email notification will be sent for each confirmed appointment and payment to administrators
b.	We would need to be able to see history of procedures per customer (by date range)
c.	We would need to be able to see history of procedures per Service Provider (by date range)
6.	This would be contract-only to the Application Developer – i.e. we would own the code and run the infrastructure
7.	We would need the Application Developer to be available for bug-fixes and software updates
8.	Performance-based equity incentive is available to Application Developer

Please send proposals to Rob Shujman at rob@balbody.com

name: Saad Mugbel
comment: I want you to create an app which is a platform for Part Time Jobs Only, so that the recruiter and seekers are on one platform.

name: Thomas Schilbach
comment:
What Operating systems? 
IOS and Android

Will the APP be listed on the App stores for download? If so will it be free or paid download?
The App will be listed on the App stores. The download will be for free.

Are there any other APPS or websites that offer similar features? 
Other Apps which are similar with regards to functionality are ‘DCard’ and ‘The Entertainer’ In terms of design we like ‘Uber’ We would like to have a black background and a golden font. We like clear and crisp design.

Please describe, in your own words, the way the app would function, and the benefits for the app users?
The App allows the end user to identify himself as an eligible customer for specific discount rates at the preferred partner outlets. The app provides on overview, addresses and contact details of the partner outlets and allows to give an estimate/actual achieved saving over the contractual period.


Please describe the features of the APP for the user by each feature?
5.1 Feedback System for App - The importance of having some way for users to provide feedback on the app is critical. Whether it is a button or a link to open an email doesn’t matter; the important part is that we give our users a quick way to report bugs, and provide suggestions or criticisms.
5.2 Social Media Login Feature - Possibility to use Facebook Connect or another single sign on technology solution to allow the customers to use their social media logins to sign into the mobile app (and keep them signed in). Also giving them a way to retrieve their user name/password or remind them which social network they used when setting up the app as well as being able to share information with their friends.
5.3 Analytics - We want to be able to analyze who has used which merchant, when, how often and how much money was saved and spent.
5.4 Offline Capabilities - It’s frustrating to users when an app is entirely unusable just because they have a weak signal. Ideally the content or interactivity doesn’t rely on a wireless signal. Communication for the analytics part can be done as soon as the customer is online again.
5.5 Loyalty Enhancing Features - Ability to send selected customers a virtual scratch card as well as to include a ‘Refer a Friend’ functionality.
5.6 Push message – App user must be able to receive push message from Admin backend.
5.7 Contact - Make it easy for customers to contact us with in-app emailing, and one-touch calling- no need to save or remember numbers. This feature will keep contact information easily accessible for the customer when they want to find it.
5.8 Customer Reviews - Allows customers to submit reviews and testimonials for the merchant services used
5.9 Menu - The ability to list Merchants alphabetically or by category
5.10 Merchants - Provide a description of the provided discount, contact information and address inclusive of a call facility
5.11 Savings - The customer should have the possibility to enter the amount spent as well as the amount saved after completion of a transaction and to share this via social media. The total amount saved should be also available for the customer.
5.12 Gift Voucher - The customer should have the possibility to buy the app for a friend as a gift. The friend should receive an image which allows him by clicking to download the app and the functionality.
5.13 Security - As part of the redemption procedure there might be a need to include a picture of the customer to prevent swapping of devices.
5.14 Renewal - The customer should receive a reminder and a renewal link towards the end of his validity period. The customer should be able to choose 1 or 2 years validity
5.15 The App should contain a FAQ section
5.16 Terms & Conditions
5.17 The customer should have the possibility via the App to like our page as well as to follow us on twitter



Do you require an admin Back end to manage the app on a daily basis?
The admin back end is mainly used for push notifications which will take place once a months. In this push notifications Customer will be advised on the change in merchants and other offers

What sort of functions are required from the backend admin? 
Pls see point 6

Do you require a web site front end? If so have your registered your domain?
We will require a web site front end. The web site should have at least 3 sub pages to the home page. One page for individuals with a video of how the redemption works as well as who our merchant partners are. It will also include a payment gateway to purchase the card or the functionality of the app. The second page is targeted on the corporate clients with regards to the employee benefit program and the third page is for merchants with a presentation why they should become part of our network.

Have you done any design work on the APP ie. App logo or screenshot slides?
No Design yet but black background and white/gold writing is currently favorable

Does the APP require the user to register to use it?
Yes, This ensures that the customer has paid his fee. The validity should be one or two years depending on the customers choice

The desired launch date is December 2015

name: Mahyar Ghaedi
comment:
The idea is to make an app that is all about location. The main function in the app will be that you will be able to connect to some of your friends and see where they are live at all times (Kind of like Apple's "Find My Friends" app). The idea here is to make the app much simpler to use, and give the user full control and overview over who can see their live location.
The app should be built up on log in with Facebook, and from there you will see your friends from facebook who are on the app, and from there you will be able to send a request for live sharing your location to eachother.

Besides the live feed, there will also be a "My Journey" which is all the places you check in and all your friends check in. This will allow people on your friendslist to see what you have been up to, which letting them know where you are at all time. You should for example be able to check in at a restaurant, sports event, clubbing or something else. (I'm thinking Foursquare API)

The UI will be a map screen with your friends live location (mainscreen),  and the "My Journey" screen with all people's check-in's (right side), and private check ins to your friends on the left. 

I have the entire UI design ready, and can send it to you so that you understand it all better if you're interested.

I'm looking to completely mitigate the issue of IT staff, or on-site staff (leasing agents, property managers, etc.) from having overhead on accounting control. If a resident can login with another credential that they already have (example: cell phone number), then no accounts need to be provisioned for every tenant, as account creation could take place at log-in. Using a cell phone number allows us to identify the user who was on a specific computer at a specific time as well for liability. If you could be of assistance in developing such an application, please contact me and we can further go over the details and requirements of the application!

Thank-you!

Josh

Android app that has one screen with 1) Date and outdoor weather on top (high and low), 2) below that it will have 4 column sections A) Today's Event's B) Shopping List C) To Do List and D) Other Lists (can be multiple). Events and lists should be editable and ability to re-arrange. It should be able to sync with google and apple calendars. In b/w the arrows should be an Icon that says the month. If you click that it will go to the month view. There should be an add button where you can add an event. Hello,

I am in the early stages of developing a start up company and am just trying to get a sense of: time, cost, and any other necessities for the app development.

name: Joseph Phillips
comment:
1.	Scope of Work
As per our understanding the client is looking forward to develop an IOS and Android Application. The application is a social application where user and dance instructors would be able to interact with each other. Every instructor will have a page listing, which would showcase their accomplishments, awards, and reviews from their past experiences. Users will choose their instructor with whom they would be able to interact through videos, photos, voice, audio and text.
The application would be sync with the admin panel where admin would be able to monitor and have complete control of the application.


1.1 Application model
Application will have three types of users

User: Users will be able to download the application from app store. The application will be downloaded and installed on their devices and will create a launcher icon. Users can click on launcher icon to start the application. The first screen would be splash screen which will have name and logo of the application and tagline.

Within the short interval of time the user would be asked to sign up through social networking apps
i.e.	Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Email. After the user would sign up he would be directed to view the tutorial of the application. User would have the provision to skip the tutorial and redirected to next page.
After the tutorials the user would be asked to complete his profile. After the completion of his profile he would be required to select the instructor.

After the user will choose their instructor, they will be able to choose limited services which would be provided from every instructor. Services would be:
•	One time feedback
•	More than one feedback
•	Limited feedback for fixed amount of time.
•	Face-to-face to meet
All the packages provided would depend upon the instructors which they would be providing.

The user will be able to upload their videos, photos, voice, audio, and text questions, and the data will be displayed in a timeline. The timeline would be in private with the user and instructor.
 
After instructor would view the users would be able to reply to them with video, photos, voice audio, and text. All this conversation would be done on a single timeline which would be private.

2.	Instructor
There would be premium category and non premium category of instructor. The admin would choose the category of the instructor. Every instructor would have his own personalized dashboard where his achievements and accomplishments. Every instructor will have a page listing, which would showcase their accomplishments, awards, and reviews from their past experiences. Every instructor would have their own packages listed. Instructors would have a provision to view the profile of the student who would request. On the basis of the profile the instructor would be able to accept or reject him.

3.	Administrator

Complete application will be monitored and managed by Admin using the management tools that we will provided. Admin will be able to:
-	Manage User information
-	Manage Instructors
-	Manage Notifications
-	Manage All Media files
-	Manage Payments
-	Manage Packages
-	CMS [manage content, images, hyperlinks, etc. on all pages]
-	Logout

name: Jana Burnikel
comment:
Map My Beauty is a startup with headquarters in New York and in Saarbrücken, Germany. We are developing a mobile iOS app that personalizes beauty for consumers, driving beauty discovery, trial and shopping for beauty brands and retailers. At each custom beauty counter within the app, our digital beauty advisor, based on our patent pending 3D technology and state-of-the-art recommendation engine, guides the consumer to the right looks, products and shades for her, and offers tailored tutorials based on an analysis of her selfie (skin tone, skin undertone, eye distance etc.). We are cooperating with beauty brands and retailers to get their beauty looks and products integrated into our system and make it possible for the consumer to shop her favorite products and cosmetic looks right through the app. 

Since our current app launch is planned for mid November, we are currently looking into outsourcing some of our tech apps to a professional app development team. name: Navin Ashokan
comment:
VoiceEarn is a boutique Digital Marketing company based our of Dubai – UAE, providing Digital Marketing Services to its clients in the Middle East & North African region. 
Client Introduction: The client is a Sports Management Company and football training academy affiliated to a local club with intention to provide training to school children and young adults with complete facilities like a football pitch, coaches, doctors and medical facilities to manage sports injuries as well as equipment and sports clothes on sale via an eCommerce enabled mobile application on IOS & Android devices.
On behalf of this client VoicEarn is requesting a Request for Quote for building a Mobile application in 3 phases.
Phase I – Beta Testing to internal audience 
Project Abstract: Currently around 50 odd players who are affiliated to the club plays regularly with external teams and amongst themselves. They predominantly use whatsapp as a communication tool to 
Fix an event: An initiator initiates an event with a date, time and place on whatsapp.
Gather player interest: Seeing this the interested players either accept, deny or say ‘maybe’ on the message.
Arrange the Venue: The initiator then messages the Football club which owns the pitch to block the venue for a time based on the number of players accepting the event.
Planning the game: The initiator then proceeds to gather players who play in set positions in a game. i.e. Center Forward, Right & Left inner & outer players, Defense & goal keepers.
Arrange Pickup: On the day of the game some players decide to travel together and arrange transport by coordinating among themselves.
Bouquets & Brickbat discussion on previous games: Player comment on previous games shaming or commending on players or opposition team members.
Photos & Video gallery: Videos & photos are posted by all players who are playing.
This app will streamline all communication for this event & smoothen the process by a minimum of 3 clicks for each user to accept the game and start playing. Users can create their own profile with images and a short bio about themselves in their sporting avatar along with favorite football star avatars as their alter ego imagery on their profiles. 
Phase II – Communication platform to external audience – Refer ‘Jogabo’ on the apple store. In the 2nd phase the app functionalities will be extended to other clubs who can register their own group on the platform and extend the same capabilities to its players.
Clubs can then arrange matches across clubs with similar capabilities as phase I.
The app can be made available across Apple Store & Google Play for players to download and see which clubs are near their office or residence and if there are any practice sessions in the coming days. Users can then request to join the club and upload their own profile. 
Phase III – Market Place integration with eCommerce capabilities.
Currently the sponsors like Adidas & Nike and other sporting brands offer to sell their merchandise to these clubs via routine try-outs at the games, a marketplace could be integrated for players to order and buy these products directly from the app. Players could also pay their yearly fees and per game fees via a credit card on the app.

Vendors are requested to provide 
1.	Their understanding of the project
2.	An approach note on the 3 phases & build process
3.	Technologies used
4.	Portfolio with links to existing work done
5.	Team bios with capabilities
6.	Timeline of the project 
7.	Cost and payment terms.

Send all replies to action@voicearn.com with ‘RFQ for football app development’ clearly marked on the subject.

name: Nabil Khan
comment:
Good Morning,

I am looking to explore the development of a mobile app (iOS and Android) for our organization. We are looking to develop an app that has two main groups of users.

1) First Group: General Public

We would like to have some basic functionality to engage with our users with push notifications, general information on our company, satellite fleet, coverage maps, new development, channels on our fleet.

Then we would like to add some tools for users to be able to setup home dishes by giving them technical setting information for set top boxes and also angels and directions for them to setup their dishes to aim at our satellites. Also we would like to add a function like Stargazer where the user can point their camera at the sky and through AR our satellites are highlighted. Also several other functionalities that can be added after some other ideas have been vetted.

2) Second Group: Business Clients

As out clients are TV broadcasters and other major media companies and government clients we would like to have a separate offering for these users. We would like to have federated access for these users to their contract details, technical performance metrics against SLAs, push notifications on outages and other services related activities, technical help-desk, a Link-budget tool that will give results based on input from the users.

3) Occasional B2B Capacity.

This would primarily be a reservation request system that would allow potential customers to request capacity for a short period of time, basically we would like to replicate the functionality of a hotel room reservation system, but apply it to satellite capacity.

Thanks and I look forward to your response.

Nabil Khan
Director of Corporate Planning
Strategy, Dept
Es'hailSat
+974 5586 9500
nkhan@eshailsat.qa

name: Toussaint Crawford
comment:
roblem to be solved:  I want people to open an app.  That app will be on a map, uber style.  I want it to read out available cleaning appointments at that time and area.  Kinda like Open table but i like the visual aspect of uber. It's kinda like a game. I'd like this to be open to any office, but my office in silver spring, md will be first. It would ideally need to be scalable to go nationwide. But i am perfectly happy with the absolutely smallest/leanest thing that works for my current needs.  It would not need to hook in to a system yet, but it will have its own schedule which each office loads such that each office would just have one column of appointments reserved for this app.  In the end, the app will need the functionality to hook in to schedules, but this will do for now.  I'd like to drive down the cost of filling a dental schedule.  Many different features can be added in time. 

But for now: Person A looks on his iphone app at 2:43 pm and notices Office A has an available 5pm appointment. He selects that appointment, the office receives all his info and are notified he's coming. Person A rates the provider. Office rates person A.

This idea is not be shared by anyone but those who work on it. Thank you.

thanks,
saint

name: Fernando Serto
comment:
I'm looking for someone to develop an app (iOS/Android) and thought I should send a brief description of what we need.

The app will be a way for people to "find" each other based on matching interests and skills, including geolocation.

Would you be able to send me an estimate of cost and how long it would take to develop?

What we need in the app:

- Login Page
* Identity Management using AWS (Cognito, etc)
* Sign Up with email address
* Sign Up with Facebook
* Sign Up with Google+ (optional)
* Share settings/state with other devices

- Profile
* Name, email, date of birth
* Location (Country, State, City)
* Photo (multiple profile photos - preferably all stored on AWS S3)
* Profile type (3 profile types - haven't decided how we'll use this yet)
* Skills (picker ~20 options) - 3 levels of proficiency - select onscreen - allow one primary Skill and as many secondaries as possible
* Interests (picker ~5 options)
* "Hobbies" (picker ~20-30 options)

- "News Feed"
* News Feed page
* Feeds from RSS
* Feeds from specific twitter accounts
* Feeds from News/Magazine sources (unsure how/what format)
* Backend admin w/ ability to add sources and twitter accounts to follow based on "Hobbies" from profile
* Allow comments on news articles/tweets, only shown within the platform, not posting comments on public sites
* Allow users to post articles, status, photos, and media files

- Friends/Followers
* Allow users to become friends
* Allow users to follow others even if not friends
* Allow users to block others

- Events
* Allow users to schedule Events
* Allow users to make content/files of these events public/private (only participants)

- Groups
* Allow users to create Groups
* Allow members to be admin of the group
* Allow users to make a Group Page public
* Allow users to make content/files of these groups public/private (only members)

- Match/Search
* Match users by Skills (everything but my own primary skill)
* Match users of different Skills by Geo Location (same city)
* Refine Match/Search by Location (same city/state/country)
* Refine Match by Skills with ability to include your own primary skill
* Refine Match by proficiency on skills
* Search for Services (ie, training/coaches for certain skills)
* Show results with profile photo, name, skills (show logo for primary skill)

- Services
* Backend admin to add services (allow these users access similar to facebook Pages - company)

- Menu slider (like LinkedIn app)
* Link to Profile
* Link to Friends
* Link to Notifications
* Link to Events
* Link to Groups
* Link to Feed
* Link to My Files (uploaded via web interface - using AWS S3)
* Link to Settings

- Web Interface for Upload
* Login with same account (using email or Facebook/Google+)
Browse for file
* Upload File (to AWS S3) - files may be Audio/Video/Docs
* Allow user to make File available to public/event/group
* If files are public, they appear on the News Feed of all followers
* If files are on event, they appear on the News Feed of all participants and can also be then made public to the news feed of all followers of all participants
* If files are on group, they appear on the groups page and can be made public on the news feed of all followers of the members of the group


Regards,
Fernando

name: Adam Lambert
comment:
My partner and I are looking to establish a business relationship with an app design and development company to get our idea underway. We're looking chiefly at an iOS app that functions as a business oriented social network. That said, it's going to be bare bones, avoiding many of the faux pas of data collection, targeted advertising, solicitation of information, etc. that push users away from established social networks. Our app will focus on three things: 1) instantaneous business connection, 2) easily customizable privacy, and 3) in-app communication (IM functions).
We've already worked out many ideas with regard to form and function, but want the  design and development expertise of a company like Openxcell behind us. We'd love to know what our first several weeks working with you would look like. Once a business relationship is established and we're past the NDA, we'd love to move forward immediately with design. You'd be working alongside myself in that regard, as my partner is essentially the wallet.

I appreciate your time, and look forward to your response.

Take care,
--Adam

name: john callison
comment:
hello-

I am currently getting estimates as to how much our clients app will cost. Can we get an estimate for cross platform and just IOS? Below are the specifications for the first round of the app. More capabilities will be added later.

All app design and graphics will be done by us we need to now how much it will cost to code and develop it. 

the apps first round capablities:

1. Be able to scan a QR code or Bar code off a sign at the store using any smart phone.
2. After the scan direct the shopper's phone to the correct platform to download the app.
3. Customer can sign up for the app free but must use a valid email as a user name.
4. Allow a set number of points to be collected on the app for every scan over a 24 hour period. Meaning they can't scan the same item twice in one day.
5. Allow the store or manufacturer to coupon through the app immediately so a bar code can be scanned at the register. If possible have 1 bar code to scan for all offers they scanned as a total tally instead of many separate bar codes for each item.
6. Allow the store and manufacturer to collect data on the items purchased for further couponing via email.
7. Keep a list of recently purchased items in the app.

John Callison

ThriveDesignGroup.com

name: rahul kisansingh bais
comment:
1.VEHICLE TRACKING OVERVIEW FEATURES​: 
­Real Time Location and Tracking on Map 
­Vehicle Moving Time 
­Idle Time 
­Stoppage Time 
­Speed 
­Longitude­Latitude Position 
­On/Off Vehicle by SMS 
­Start/Stop Engine Report 
­AC On/Off Alert 
­Geofencing 
­Replay Facility 
­Speed Restriction 
­Crash Alert 
­Stolen Vehicle Recovery 
­Two Way Calling 
­Panic Button 
­Tampering Alert for Device & Battery 
­Daily Vehicle Travelled Report 
 
∙​         ​Vehicle Tracking System should broadly consist of the following features: 
  
i. Device should have GPS receiver antenna inbuilt to receive satellite                     
signals, and transfer vehicle movement data to a central server                   
through GPRS/ GSM networks. 
ii. Receiving SOS/alerts from vehicle in case of incidents/ accidents. 
iii. 2­way voice communication between the vehicle driver and user/control                   
room. 
iv. Central server will host the Tracking application to manage and monitor                       
vehicle 
performance. 
iv. Mobile applications for customers to receive service related information                   
in real time. 
  
∙​         ​Vehicle movement data should capture the following: 
  
i.  Longitude and latitude position of vehicle. 
ii. Location of vehicle in movement (displaying location with address/                   
vehicle number/ Driver Id/Direction of travel/ date/ time/ speed/ etc). 
iii. Over­speeding, harsh acceleration/braking etc. 
  
∙​         ​Display Map Requirements: 
  
Vector GIS map of India of at least 1:2500 scale. Licensed Google                       
maps can be used for the purpose. Maps should be refreshed at                       
pre configurable intervals. 
i) Actual movement of vehicles. 
ii. Real­time running position. 
iii. Auto headway detection. 
iv. Recorded details of the vehicle movement for a period of three 
  months online and archived data for 5 years. 
v. Flashing icon for breakdown, accident, and emergency, idle vehicle etc 
vi. Geo­coding/fencing 
vii. Allow for import/ export of data in excel format to/from the map. 
viii. Control display of vehicle based on user role for a query. 
ix. Support multiple window views for an overview with capabilities to close                       
up and enlarge 
  a screen of interest with a pop up of all the information related to the                             
vehicle/s. 
  
  
∙​         ​Alerts from the VTS system: 
  
The VTS system shall have the ability to raise alerts associated in the                         
context of the operations and Vehicle Tracking and Monitoring.                 
Following are some of the specific cases in which alerts should be                       
generated: 
  
i. Alerts will be displayed on the monitoring console and an extract of the                           
same will be 
available on the user dashboard. 
ii. The Control Room operator shall be able to drill down to the exact                           
location of the event 
by clicking on the alert and see the position of event drawn over the map                             
along with 
driver, vehicle and standard description of event details. 
iii. Alerts from moving through the operation of a panic button provided                       
along with the VTS Unit. 
iv. Alerts on exceptions for all other pre­configured parameters such as                     
driver behavior, over­speeding. 
v. Appropriate authorities through the control Command centre / Customer                   
should be able to interact with driver. Customer should be able to                       
instruct drivers. Only customer will be able to initiate the call and                       
driver will be provided with a emergency button to communicate to                     
the customer which in turn will initiate the call using the system. 
vii. Alerts for service and maintenance 
  
∙​         ​Driver­support and Behavior Information System: 
  
i. The Device must have in built sensitive microphone and speakers                     
maybe provided for 
communication. The Device must be positioned in such away the driver                     
can speak and 
listen from his seat. The Device must be rugged should withstand                     
vibrations, temperature 
and possible washing.  
To interact with Customer device should be installed in a place which will                         
provide safety and convenience for driver to handle the calls. 
ii. The driver will use 2way communication facility made available to                     
communicate with the 
Customer by pressing the appropriate button for the specific incident. 
  
  
  
  
2.Health Requirement by Accost: 
  
This Health Portal of Accost is divided in two types: 
A) Ambulance 
B) Hospitals 
  
  
  
  
  
  
A) Ambulance: 
  
i. It is feature which must be displayed on the application in the Health                           
portal. 
ii. The Ambulance which Accost has tied up, information of that                     
Ambulance will be displayed on the Google map with the complete                     
address and contact details. The distance of the service provider                   
from the customer should be also shown in the Google map. 
iii. Information about the type of Ambulance (Normal/Cardiac/Emergency               
etc) should be displayed. 
iv. As soon as the Customer searches the Ambulance in the search                       
engine he should get a system generated message about the related                     
list of the Ambulance which he has searched. Customer should get                     
message on mobile or notification in the application. Also he should                     
be able to see Service Provider in List view as well as in Map view in                               
the application itself.

name: Paras Parmar
comment:
Name: Satsang Ahnik Challenge

We would like to create a social app (similar to FitBit and other exercise group apps) that allow devotees of the Swaminarayan faith to share and encourage the daily practice of their faith. They would have to complete 10 tasks a day, each with a different requirement. At completion of the task, the app would microblog the completion on their user wall and/or on the social media interface of their choice (ex. Twitter, Google Plus, etc.) The tasks include:
1. Daily Arti - Tick the box when they do arti twice a day
2. Puja - Listen to a 5 min. audio of a chant. At the completion of the track the task would be considered complete.
3. Chandalo - They must take a photo of their face and upload it daily.
4. Mansi - They must describe what they did in their mansi puja in a message.
5. Scripture Reading - They must answer three to five multiple choice questions on the passage they read. (Require pre-made database of questions for each passage that are called by app when the user selects their passage of the day)
6. Mansi/Chesta - they would have to watch an small video. On completion of the video, the task would be considered complete.

They would receive one point for each task completed. The total points of the day would be messaged at the end of the day. The points would be accumulate for the week. The total points would be useful in the social aspects of the app - the group leaderboards, etc. Once the week is over, the data would be visible in the history of the individual user but not to followers or groups.

The social aspects:
1. Each user has a homepage which tracks their progress and performance.
2. Each user can follow and be followed by others. Followers would be able to see the user wall of the person they follow.
3. Users send reminders or encouragement in non-verbal form (like pokes on the original facebook)
4. Users can form groups to compete with and encourage each other.

Other possible functions:
1. Setting alarms for reminders for the tasks.
2. Media bank of media that can help with each of the tasks.
3. Notifications on their phone for reminder/achievements
4. Moderation: Followers may "DQ" (disqualify) task completions. If a user gets three or more DQs then their profile would be sent to the apps admin or moderator who would judge if the DQs are legitimate or just hassles. If the DQs are legitimate, the task completions would remained cancelled. If the DQs are illegitimate, the completion points would be reinstated and the people pulling the allegations would be discredited points.

These are our initial thoughts. We'd like to sit with you face to face to further develop this app. We're not happy with only digital, non-human contact. Let us know when we can meet your team in person.

Thanks.
