name: Matthias Peiss
comment:
Dear Sir or Madam,

This is a request for the development and testing of a hybrid (iOS, Android) mobile application for smartphones.

The scrutinized application is of the type:  Anonymous network application. 

With all the following aspects being in place – idea, concept, design, business strategy –, the primary focus of this request concerns the coding task per se.

A good benchmark regarding many core elements and functions is the German application “Jodel” (https://jodel-app.com/).

Hence, basic requirements are:

-	Anonymous posting with reply, chat, reporting, sharing, and ranking (e.g. popularity) options
-	Home screen providing navigation as to popularity, time (“latest”), vicinity (“nearby”) of posts
-	Standard interface elements and buttons etc.

In addition, a subject-specific categorization of posts shall be provided (via tabs on the home screen) to the user.

No requirements exist regarding:

-	User login system(s)
-	Complex graphical elements or digital image processing
-	Tracking frameworks
-	Video and audio streaming, photo sharing and others
-	In-app purchases, bluetooth/ NFC/ USB/ WLAN


Given the above specifications we would appreciate nonbinding information on the approximate cost interval your team would estimate for this job.


Thank you,
Matthias Peiss

name: Michael Lippe
comment:
Hello,

We are looking for a company to build our website that will be similar to FanDuel.com, Vulcun.com, and Yahoo Daily Fantasy (https://sports.yahoo.com/dailyfantasy). On these websites, there are tournaments set up by the website, as well as user-generated head-to-head contests.

There will be one major difference with our website: the team creation process (including the list of payers and their salaries) when joining a contest will not be necessary since our website's contests will only involve the pairing of users to compete in the contest (the ability to join the contest and then payout the winner(s)). In this respect, our website will be simpler than the other websites listed above. A good analogy is to imagine you want to challenge someone to an arm wrestling match. You would go to our website, find an open head-to-head contest, join and pay the entry fee (for example, $5), complete the arm wrestling match, and then the winner is paid out the $10 (minus the website's commission).

List of features include:
- User registration
- Payment integration (deposits/withdrawal)
- "Create contest" feature to allow users to create their own tournaments
- Manually add tournaments via the backend
- Contest list similar to on the homepage of https://vulcun.com/
- Entering contests and paying out the winner(s) by crediting their account(s)

Please provide an estimated quote for a full-featured website similar to the aforementioned websites, noting the important difference described above. Please exclude design costs from your quote.

Thank you,
Michael Lippe

name: Stefano Bersigotti
comment:
I prefer to be contacted by email.
Basic Rough Idea: Creating an app that will let you choose flight/train/bus seats based on who's suppose to sit next to you (using the seats chart system used by setaguru.com). So you can choose your setamate. Once registered in app, you can indicate the seat chosen and important info about self
or can book first to see others info while choosing seats. Registration easy + privacy regulations.
In other words, I mean, once you are registered on that app, you can indicate the seat you have chosen and some important information about yourself (e.g. interests, hobbies, job, etc.), or you can see all the passengers already registered and seated in your specific flight, in order to choose where to seat
How it works: Example- If you have already bought a flight ticket to go from SFO to HNL, you just have to register on app, put your ticket number (so we can check that you already have a ticket and you are not just looking for someone) then you put your airline's number and so we can show you the right seat chart. If you just want to tell everybody your seat, just select what you did choose with your airline and wait till you discover who's going to sit next to you. if not see who already indicated his/her sit and based on their info and picture profile you can choose your seat.
User Community Voting: Users can vote up/down on other users after sitting with each other
"SEATM8" is a revolutionary new app that allows users to both submit basic get-to-know you
information, along with their seat listing, and view other user profiles by where they are
confirmed to sit for optimum user seating preference and travel experience.
All information is provided by each user, per seat and profile preference. Facebook registration
integration is required for verification of basic information for "SEATM8" administrators. Other
than user chosen information, "SEATM8" does not release any other information than what is
saved in user profiles per seat choice.  "SEATM8" is not liable for the information put on
profiles, as they are user based, but false profiles, profanity, and community down voted user
profiles will be suspended, reviewed, and in some cases banned. Registration requests that
don't pass the verification will be rejected.

Due to some samples I have seen in your portfolio and through the appealing design of your own site, I shortlisted you and would like to get a first feedback regarding the project, where you would see your strong points as a partner and a basic quotation. 

As soon as you contacted me, I will sent you a first rough briefing via email. 

The requirements for this project are:
- modern webdesign according to exact description
- professional development of the coding
- since the website has to be accessible in China, no Google API's can be used
- embedded maps shall be done with OpenMap
- regular communication and professional feedback on a daily basis to discuss development is a must
- designers have to be creative and bring in their own ideas
- Any Wordpress elements would need to be tested in China first for functionality
- Deadlines have to be kept without exceptions. Failing to do so will result in termination of the project
- the site has to be fully SEO optimized for terminology
- the site has to be fully mobile friendly, as many users will access it via phone
- the site should be coded for multiple language use in the future

I am looking for a long term partner with this website, who will also in future assist with development / hosting/ design and support. Therefore please outline to me why a cooperation between us would be mutually beneficial. Please have a careful look at the project and prepare your feedback tailored on the requirements. Standardized submissions will be ignored. 

Regarding the time line, since it is an ongoing project, exact details will be discussed after first quotation stage. However, for the time being there is no time pressure for this project. 

Cheers,
Jan

name: Ryan Langham
comment:
To give you a brief description I am personal trainer and have had this idea of creating a fitness app that navigates people through their street or parks, and along their way the app will tell them what type of exercises to perform at different points along their journey. It will also track there progress and give them a complete report on their session. 

The idea is for it to be named Fitness Scavenger Hunts or FSH Challenge. I have looked at a few apps out their and all seem to be focusing on the past or tracking and not to much focusing on the present. Our focus is to have a routing algorithm that will guide them in their local area. 

Like most tracking apps it will give you a summary of what you have just done, but in our case we wanted people to be taken on a journey so at the end of it they look at the map summary they will see a shape on the map showing a basic pattern or words. Their was advert for map my run a few years back where the guy run and the map had a picture of a heart on it which he screen shot and sent to his girlfriend. We want to create an app that will calculate which route to take to create certain words or pictures based on the clients location. And long that journey they will have a pin pop/old school map pop up suggesting  what exercises they need to do challenging either through photo of video tutorial which guides them along there way. I wanted the app to be able to have a social community where they can share there accomplishments and post it to their social media site. 

I wanted to be able to incorporate some other features that I have seen in other apps, like taking the best pieces and creating a super. So the connectivity with fitness trackers, motivational blurbs that get people up and moving, seamless food recording and accurate tracking. Ongoing reminders to be active. 

We have also started an athletic apparel line which we want to sell through the app.

I also wanted to design a second app based around a wedding fitness program for 12 weeks detailing their day to day routines which will have automatic reminders of when and what to eat, when and what exercise to do. It's called shed to wed. 

I look forward to discussing this in more detail with you. I'm am free to talk tomorrow between 9:30am and 2:pm Brisbane time.

name: Morgan Hill
comment:
We are creating a process to take our existing documents in excel and word, convert them into templates, and then create project management forms to input new data into the templates to create a new document. The data will be backed up and stored in a database for quick recall and change monitoring.

Then exporting completed documents to email distribution lists.

This will be for our in house purposes, and should be web based, but also open to expanding to mobile (with optional front end redesign/integration).

The web application/mobile application form will use JavaScript and create templates that docxtemplater a Node.js package will create into docx, excel documents (via xlsx-templater) both GitHub JS projects.

For database storage: We are open, but anything that works well with Javascript and can lead to mobile application development. (NoSQL/Oracle, MySQL).

For integration: Open to using DropBox for file storage or any other application that could integrate a way to store files and check in/out/ collaborate. Alternatively, building out if possible, we'd love to have check in/check out features for the files.

For hosting: Currently only using php/mysql, will need to expand to Google App Engine or Amazon Web Services for this build to use javascript and Node.js. (I can set it up or you can).

Would also like ability to use an eSignature application like "HelloSign". To Summarize the project:


- I'm not really particular on the exact full stack and framework, I just need the features listed, and know that javacript with Node.js for the office document api will be best. Everything else is up to your team.

A web/mobile application (at least web initially) that is user/profile based that:
1. Make web form that allows for input into DocX and XLSX templates.
2. Integrate web-form to save templates to a database/load templates from dbase.
3. Process templates to create DOCX and Excel Documents via docxtemplater/xls templater javascript libraries (using Node.js)
4. Save documents and notify users that are associated with the templates of new updates. Also ability to check in/out files, or at least notification.
5. Ability to save documents/email members of document lists/notify of updates via email.
6. Upon notification, allow parties to sign electronically via another App like "HelloSign"

name: sabah sharma-holmes
comment:
Hi there, I am in the process of setting up a socially responsible brand and am looking for a strong agency partner who can help with website design, app development, social media marketing, seo and analytics, online advertising at the outset - basically an lot of the stuff you do already do. I wish you did branding and logo design as well! We are a startup for-profit business with a defined social goal.

Right now - I want to get an idea of the costing etc so i can budget or look at potential investments being diverted towards this if the proposal is promising.


My business is going to be an online one - where the sales are driven to educate/feed and/or provide shelter for children in need. We have started with sponsoring children who are blind/deaf and dumb at a government institution in gurgaon.

We will be selling fashion and real jewellery & accessories - targeted at medium to high income earners, all nationalities - primarily in european/scandanavian, us, canadian, middle eastern markets and the secondary market would be india.

Mine is a profit-based model with a defined social impact and I’ll also be working with some individuals and organisations who are focussing on projects in the north of India to drive support/awareness for girl child education & development initiatives. So an integral part of the business and website will be to make it transparent and visible as to what we do with our earned profits - to let customers know the good their money is doing for children in need. AS we grow - we will obviously expand our efforts and coverage of those in need. In the beginning our goals are modest and our focus is on underprivileged children. In order to be sustainable and unlike NGOs who operate at the mercy of other people’s money – we are aiming to keep our overheads as low as possible. To begin with – I’m putting a lot of my own money in as I want zero to limited investors and I want to really maximize value.

I want the brand to be positioned as a high-end one but one that is also relatable, real and down-to-earth – a real dichotomy just as a profitable business that is established to provide a platform to the poorest sections of society is. It is a for profit business as one of our core values is to be sustainable in order to create sustainability for the people and projects we support.

So that's a brief about us - I can ofcourse share more details or answer specific questions but if based on this you can help me with an understanding of what your services will cost – I would be grateful. Naturally, as a start-up whose core value is to be sustainable, we would like to keep our overheads as low as possible - without compromising the investment we need to do in establishing a strong brand that can drive our success from the beginning. I hope that your costing and level of support would possibly reflect this…….

If what I’m doing is of interest and you might be able to support both with a reasonable cost of service provision - do please get in touch with me.

I'm currently out of India so I can be reached on my Dubai number on 00971559531310. I hope to be back in India in a month's time and my India number is 00919971430313.

Do please text me if I miss your call and I’ll be sure to call you back.

Thanks a ton for taking the time to go through my query and look forward to your response!

Warmest regards,
Sabah

Hi

My name is Daniel Micallef. I am in the initial stages of designing an application. I am an Internet Security Specialist and although have slight experience in computer programming, I wouldn't say I am familiar with the development and publishing or iPhone/Android Applications.

Application Background

The application will have  the same idea and functionality as the well-known application 'Tinder'. (Not a dating application but there will be matching of users)  I.e. it will use location services to scan for nearby users where you would be able to view profile and choose whether to match with person or not. Also, Users will also, have the option to set their own tags which will influence the system on the type of users that a specific user would be interested in. Also, a filtering functionality will be in place so a user can choose what type of users to browse through depending on criteria of the tags.

I hope this is enough information to get the ball rolling and get the information I require. I'm sure you understand that I would not like to give too much information at this stage.

I would like to know:

1. If you are able to help me with the development, publishing and possibly marketing. I would like to take care of the design/look and feel of the application.

2. What do your services include? i.e. Will I have an application ready on the app store/Google Play or will you provide me the application and it is up to me to publish, etc.

3. Given the nature of the application, this would require some sort of back-end services (i.e. server). Is this a service that you offer. i.e. included in the price.

4. Finally, how much will this cost?

I would appreciate any other information you can give me.

Many Thanks and Kind Regards

Daniel

name: Anshul Mehta
comment:
Overview

We need a mobile application for our retail store.
We’ve a retail store which has close to 15-20 counters. Each counter offers different products and thus, customer visiting a counter is not aware of the new offerimgs on the other counter. Also, sometimes different counters have different discounts/ sale running but since, there is no way for a customer to know this, many of the customer who enter our store end up not discovering those discounts. 

Thus, we need a mobile application for iOS and android both, using which we’ll be able to communicate with clients and offer them related products based on the counter on which they have visited. 


Requirement

We need to figure out the in-store location of the client i.e. the counter on which the client is currently present*. This we want to achieve with an audio-based approach. We’ll have audio speakers placed at each of the counter which will generate sound in the specifc pattern by varying frequency. (the details of the pattern will be priovided later). Using the mobile application this audio has to be analysed.
 
(*We know beacons are one way of doing this, but most of our customers are middle class and don’t own high end phones required for BLE based communication Also, QR code option is ruled out because we figured out there will be operational challenges.)  

Thus, the major portion of work involves the following:
•	Capability in mobile application to analyse the audio and to come up with the device (or counter) code based on the specific audio pattern (frequency based)
•	Capability to send request to the server along with the device code and fetch the data from the server, and display it on the customer mobile application

Frequency Analysis of an audio signal

This can be done using the Fourier Transform. The code for the frequency analysis is available in the following links:
1.	http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12721254/how-to-calculate-sound-frequency-in-android
2.	http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5511250/capturing-sound-for-analysis-and-visualizing-frequencies-in-android
3.	http://som-itsolutions.blogspot.in/2012/01/fft-based-simple-spectrum-analyzer.html
4.	https://github.com/alexkay/spek

name: Jonathan
comment:
Hello,

I would like a quote for an app project I have in mind. Myself and a business partner are launching a website for now with the intention of developing an app to go alongside or to come a few months after the site. 

The app is a image recognition tool to identify animals and plants. 

Users will take a photo of a plant, animal. etc and the app will tell the user what the name of the image is.

The App will needs be connected to an api called ‘cloud sight’. They will provide the image recognition software for users to be able to identify photos they upload via the app. (Would appreciate any suggestions if we don’t need a separate api)

We would like the app to be able to post users activity on their favourite social media accounts like Facebook, twitter and google plus. 

We would also like the users GPS location to be available as they take the photos as we would like to use to for two reasons:

a. Revenue generation - be able to suggest local shops relevant to users ‘image’ types. E.g. They take an image of a sunflower then a shop close to them is advertised to them that sells ‘sunflowers’ etc. 
 
b. This will help in image recognition as local wildlife can be searched to identify the image they take when could sight api cannot. 

We would like incorporated a points/reward system for users. The more photos they take and are identified the more reward points they accrue. 

It needs to look clean and elegant but as there will be a points/reward system for all the images positively identified, its should also look fun. 

We would like the option of having people log in with their Facebook account or google plus account.
Also there should be a authentication/security process for the users account so that others cannot access their account and upload inappropriate photos. 

Last but not least, we would like the images supplied by users and correctly identified by api (or other source) to be stored in a database that itself is searchable and in a sense becomes better by ‘learning’ the more images are uploaded and identified. 

Thanks for your help,

Jon

name: Daniel Campbell
comment:
Hi,

My name is Daniel Campbell and I am the General Manager for MySQUAR, a tech start-up with a product focus on Myanmar. Our main product is MyChat https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.squar.mychat.release&hl=en

We are currently looking for an outsourcing pattern to share the growing load of our product road-map.

At a very high-level, the two main product requirements we feel would be best suited for outsourcing are:

1.MyChat “Official Accounts” App

A basic version of the app for “Official Accounts" in Myanmar. The app will be for accounts that work more like Facebook Pages and users can follow them. The app would have a unique log-in screen for Official Accounts. Once logged the Official accounts will only have 2 main aspects, editing their profile and interacting with the Feed:
1. Update their profiles (which appear different to normal user accounts in current app)
2. Post to the Feed
3. Reply to comments on their posts in the feed
4. Comment on other users posts on the screen

The app should reflect the main MyChat app, so if updates are made to the main Feed feature in MyChat they should be easily updatable with a new release in the MyChat Official Accounts App.

2. Web-App for Brand Accounts

Current vision for this is much like the Advertising dashboard in Facebook. Brand accounts can log in to manage their profiles (also displayed to end-user as an “Official Account” ref - LINE app), manage campaigns, view current and past campaigns with insights and costs associated, pay for a new campaign, directly message their followers by segmented groups, post content, boost posted content.


These are very high-level, so if you’d like to Skype call to discuss in more detail we’d love to chat. 

Some of the things we’d be keen to find out:

1. How do you work on an app that is also being developed by another team? Do you have any case-studies or examples of how this has worked in the past?

2. Do you have any case-studies or examples of any projects you have worked on that are at all similar to the 2 projects outlined?

3. How does your pricing work? Is it by project or duration? 

Thanks a lot for your time. Really looking to hearing back from you.

Thanks and best regards,

Daniel Campbell
daniel@mysquar.com
(Often travelling between Vietnam and Myanmar, so email is the best method of contact. Thanks!)

name: Michael Joyce
comment:
We have 2 projects that we are looking to get quotes for - 

SOFTANYWARE:

The first will be a website for our digital agency branch of our company that we're looking to launch. The basic website design is inspired by another site that you can visit at: http://jack.ventures/inner-mongolia-2014/  At the following link you can see a couple views of our proposed design: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/5m3x7ci6wqyz9ma/AABmeRla-gzWSkp27zZIOsCHa?dl=0 

There would basically be a menu on the left hand side & in the right hand side would be all videos for each section that automatically play as they are scrolled into view. Each video would explain that particular part of our company. If the user clicks on the collapse button in the upper left hand corner, then the menu collapses. If the user clicks on the read icon in the upper left hand corner, then any related text content for that particular section will slide into view, overlaying the video area.

There will be roughly 6 video sections (we will provide the videos) + a link to our blog (which we may have you would quote separately, or, we will develop ourselves & then you can link to it) + a contact form. For the sections "About Us" & "Our Work", we will be adding a column of thumbnail pictures in the expanded text content area to show portfolio work in the "Our Work" section & team photos/link to bios in the "About Us" section - in addition to that section's text content. These can be clicked on to be expanded.

99Sense:

You can view some mockups here: 
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/vlyq6f2ibdxu6mq/AAC-NFfV2cFcgIZTXkEm1qg3a?dl=0

*Note - the product grid shown in one of the mockups features 2 products across, but, we updated it to show 3 across in the other mockups.

In a nutshell, it will be an online dollar store featuring products that make a difference in the world. In addition to a fully functioning store front that should have a backend dashboard that easily allows us to organize the view, pricing, stock, shipping, tracking, etc of products, we’d need sections of the site to feature stories (such as the featured banner section story/video). We’ll need sections for our mission explanation, ways for people to submit product ideas, etc.

It might be easiest if we set up a brief call to discuss any details or questions that you may have.

name: Sam
comment:
CarBox is envisioned to be a mobile service that allows customers to book an appointment through an app to request for car care and mechanical services at their doorstep. The company will have a fleet of about 10-15 cars around various areas of Dubai that offer the following services to their customers. 

Car Care
• Basic & Premium car washing 
• Waxing & interior detailing
• Glass tinting. 

Mechanical Services
• Oil Change, Brake Fluid, Tyre change etc. 
• Electrical Services such as A/C, lights, etc


We intend to build a mobile app which allows customers to request for the above services by creating an account on the app, selecting a date and timeslot and then sharing the location where they want the service. The app would have the following features: 

• It would allow the users to create an account by simply entering their mobile no, name, and email address. 
. Get email and Confirm email address by clicking  on a link available in an email received
• The users will also have the ability to join using social connect (Fb/Linkedin/Twitter)
. User can Edit or deactivate his/ her account
. Login if already registered
. Logout 
• Post Login, the user would be prompted to choose the type of service they require (Car Care or Mechanical Service)
• On selection of the service, the user will be prompted to select a subservice (mentioned above).
• The user will then be prompted to select the type of vehicle they have (Saloon Car / 4x4 / Truck or Bus) with prices.
• The user will then be prompted to choose a location where they would like the service to be available. Choice of location can be made via section of areas and then manually entering the address, or by sharing the current location (using GPS functionality of the phone) like Uber.  

o There are certain areas in Dubai where the service will not be available, the customer should not be able to drop a pin to those areas and those should not be selectable on the map, or if they are selected then the user would be prompted that “Service is not available in your area” 

• Once the location is selected the customer should be prompted to select a date when they want the service to be done. 

• On selection of date all the available timeslots will be fetched from CRM or backend and presented to the user to choose from. Once the user selects the timeslot. It should be marked as taken in the CRM system for a period of 15 mins, until the payment is made. If the payment is unsuccessful, then the slot should be freed up again. 

The app should allow the customer to choose their preferred mode of payment. (Cash on delivery / Card on delivery / Online payment). For online payment the app should integrate with the gate2play payment gateway. Booking and payment would only be done for the car care services. If the customer wishes to opt for a mechanical service, the app would ask the user to fill out a form requesting the following details (Make of car/year etc) and then allow them to choose the mechanical service they require. 

o If they select mechanical service the app should give the customers a booking reference no (pushed to CRM or backend from the app as a new lead) and inform the user that the service would be done in the next 4 hours, and that they will get a follow up call for the request. 
The app should also allow the users to cancel a booking if required. Once the service is done, the back office system will push a notification to the app  allowing the customer to rate the service and also share a picture taken by the app (with the company logo etc.) and share it on their social networks. 

Get confirmation with driver/ car information or get a cancelation with the reason

Track the driver on the map when the driver is on his way 

When service is done, receive a notification with the amount to pay

The app should allow the customers to leave feedback, comments, or suggestions.

Receive invoice and receipt through email once payment is done 

The app should also list the service history (fetched from the customer profile in CRM or Backend). This would be a timeline of all the services done till date, with an option to repeat a particular type of service done in the past.  The app should also list the current requested services with an identifications of the status (Requested {ability to be cancelled, if required} / in progress / Done)  Once the service has been done, the service should be added to the timeline of service history, where the customer can view their invoices.  The app should also have a section to list down the current offers available. The app should also allow customers to choose a monthly contract (with payment in  advance).

The app should offer a loyalty card scheme. Where when registered to this scheme,  customers earn points on every service and can redeem them for a free service after it reaches a certain point. E.g.; every carwash earns 20 points, on reaching 100 points they can get a free car wash (after redemption, it becomes back to zero).  




Car Driver APP
Login with a predefined username and password provided by the administrator 
 View history of all the service requests received and completed
Receive notifications of a new request 
 Check the list of all the requests 
 Check the details of the request including the location of the user 
 Accept or reject the request - in case of rejection then the reason will be added 
 Send notification when going to serve a request  
 If maintenance, enter the cost of the service  
 Depending on the payment method chosen by the user, the driver processes the payment manually and confirms the payment was received

name: Mohammad
comment:
We need your development team to build us sort of a question & answer (statement & reply) website with the following main features [differentiation point]:
Users are able to post a statement about the status they are in currently and other users would be able to provide recommendations in the following manner:
1-	A book to read
2-	A place to visit
3-	A movie to watch
4-	A song to listen to
5-	A thing to do

- What we require for items 1-4 is a smart search API which can search through one or more online databases for books, movie, songs, and places and return the relevant results. For example users should be able to type in a name of a movie and the smart search filed should automatically search the database of Amazon, TheMovieDB or whatever. Please visit algolia.com for a better understanding of what we mean by smart search. Note that we don’t need ours to be this complicated, but just to search through relevant database, return the name of the book/song/movie/place. 
After an answer is submitted, any visitor who clicks on each of the abovementioned items should see a small drop down list such as: Open in iTunes / Amazon / Google Play / Spotify. Therefore, the website should be capable of identifying the correct URL of the movie, song, and the book in such databases and automatically generate these redirecting links.

- For the 5th item (a thing to do) users must have a character limit of 80 characters to fill in the space.
Features
We went through various Q&A websites but the one that got our attention is Quora, therefore we strongly recommend you to thoroughly go over quora.com and become familiar with their features and general website structure. In general we need the following features:
1-	Search within the website
2-	Upvote
3-	Downwote
4-	Messaging
5-	Anonymity options 
6-	Report user
7-	Report answer 
8-	Feeds section to summarize all the activities of a user
9-	Add to reading list
10-	Notification 
11-	Following 
12-	Send thanks to contributors (users who write the recommendations) 

13-	Profile:
14-	Biology of user
15-	A description about user
16-	What topics he/she knows
17-	Statistics about the number of answers submitted, number of followers, etc.

18-	Account settings:
1)	General
2)	Privacy
3)	Notification

Development of a Mobile Financial Services Application for Android and iOS platforms. I wish to create a mobile financial services application with the following features: 

- Access to the application will be provided through mobile data or WiFi connection
- The application will be linked to the client's mobile wallet (e.g: Airtel Money) and access to the application will be secured via a PIN or password.
- Each user will be provided a unique barcode/QR code which can be scanned by other users/merchants in order to make payments. Once scanned, the user's mobile money account will be debited and the user scanning the barcode's mobile money account will be credited.
- The application will provide a proof of finality of payments.
-The application will keep track of the user's monthly spend and provide basic analytics on how the client uses their money.

Effectively, this application will be a Point of Sale terminal that merchants and users alike can use and it will be a frictionless mode of payment.

I would appreciate if we can identify the resources required and effort in terms of hours and costs associated with timely delivery of this task.

We are looking to move fairly quickly so a quick turnaround time would be appreciated.

Thanks.

comment:
Mobile Game Development - 

I already have many elements of what I believe should be an amazing game prepared, including storyline, graphic arts for almost all characters and  obstacles.  

Final architecture, wire-frame, and subsequent programming and QA is missing, is needed and is the source for this inquiry to you.

Before getting to the NDA, I would like to know
 
1. if you have made any of your clients, particularly indie-startups,  significant money, Net Operating Income after all expenses, of say, over $1,000,000, that can be proven up with phone calls or emails to such clients?  

2. What are your biggest commercially successful games?  

3.  Will gamers all over the world (I am targeting international sales, not just US) recognize Openxcell games and be looking forward to your next production?

4. With respect to budget, I think based on almost being ready for Kickstarter campaign, it will be very low initial budget to finish getting ready for that (perhaps as little as a $1,000 or less, as the Kickstarter campaign for this game  is almost ready to go where I already am), and then perhaps over $50,000 to actually finish the game, ( for which I am interested in receiving your estimated project completion time and project completion cost proposal).  

I have a good deal of confidence that my anticipated Kickstarter campaign can accomplish this cost, perhaps with profit to spare.  

After mutual execution of an NDA I will provide you a history and scope for the game, and a link to where my Kickstarter project is at the moment, still needing some work but pretty well advanced. 

I want to issue initially on iOS for i-Phones, I-Pads, and i_Pods, and Android for Google Play for phones and tablets, followed up as closely as possible with Windows, Mobile Windows. and Amazon.

Thank you.

Sincerely,

Brian Eisberg
Managing Member
Boatman Productions, LLC

name: Dilip Rajpurohit
comment:
Hello,

Greetings from eInfochips,

Hope you find our mail in the best of spirits.

As you might already be aware, eInfochips has been a partner of choice for Fortune 500 companies for product innovation and hi-tech engineering consulting. Since 1994, the company has provided solutions to key verticals like Aerospace & Defense, Consumer Electronics, Energy & Utilities, Healthcare, Home, Office, and Industrial Automation, Media & Broadcast, Medical Devices, Retail & e-Commerce, Security & Surveillance, Semiconductor, Software/ISV and Storage & Compute.

In a bid to rebrand our identity and further our business goals, we require a revamped website with a contemporary design based on a sound branding strategy to meet our objectives. We are also keen to feature key marketing functionalities and elements embedded within the website for better marketing reach. 

Since your company is in a similar domain as ours, we assume that you will be in a better position to propose a competently designed site for us. We would like your assistance in creating a CMS-based website for us along with its associated elements.
Our Requirements: 
•	Choice of a stable and robust CMS
•	2-3 wireframes and mock-ups of a well-designed layout for the responsive website along with its mobile and tablet representations (the site will be based on a pre-defined color scheme and the logo for branding purposes)
•	Embedding of social elements and an integrated blog
•	Integration of potential content feeds of internal and external content
•	Incorporation of SEO-based elements, forms of enquiry
•	Layout consistency in terms of design and content for diverse platforms
We would need a thorough quotation from your side after a detailed discussion on our requirements. We would also like to know the entire project documentation process and how wireframes and mock-ups will be delivered, along with the required timeframe and project plan.

Looking forward to your positive reply for the same. Do reply to us or call us on 9924016179 to know more about this project assignment.

comment:
Hi, ­

I need a quote to design an application.­ My idea is an application called "SideJ­obs" and it will allow everyone in austr­alia to post advertisements for anything­ they need done, from pickup KFC meal to­ fix a tv or moving houses or anything t­hey need and they will write a descripti­on of the job, add photos of the job and­ how much theyre willing to pay to get t­he job done. At the same time the app wi­ll be a place for other people who can f­ix things or can pickup and deliver or c­lean a house to do some extra cash on th­e side "sidejobs" . 
The app will start with simple instruct­ions on how to use the app.

I need the application to have a registr­ation part and customers will add their ­personal details, and have a profile as ­well as their credit card or paypal deta­ils to get charged for the jobs they adv­ertise as well as their bank details BSB­ and bank account to get paid for the jo­bs they do.

I need the app to access the camera and ­gallery so that they can upload photos o­f the jobs.

I need the app to have private messages ­allowed so that employees can contact th­eir employers without viewing their emai­l and phone number unless both of the ac­cept to go a head with the job.

I need the app to be able to charge the ­customers once both parties have agreed ­to go on with the job in hand. Inform th­e worker that we have the money and once­ the job is finished and the employer co­mpletes the job we transfer the money to­ the employee and take a 7% commission.

I need the app to have different section­s for different types of jobs and worker­s can filter the jobs using price, locat­ion type of job. And the app will access­ the gps to locate where the closest job­s are.

I need the jobs to be available for a we­ek only and if its not finalised by then­ the job will expire and gets invisible ­of the main jobs menu but remain in an i­nactive jobs section in the posters acco­unt.

It will show how many workers are trying­ to win the job and workers can ask the ­employer questions about the job in publ­ic so others can see his comments and mo­re info about the job.

Both employers and employees cant see ea­chothers full details like phone number ­and email addresses untill the job gets ­accepted by both parties. If the employe­e or employer is typing a message and he­ closes the app for a reason it will sav­e it to his drafts folder ... so I will ­need a section in the app for inbox, sen­t, compose, draft and deleted messages f­olders.

I need the app to have different section­s for different types of jobs and worker­s can filter the jobs using job type, pr­ice, location " I need the app to access­ gps and location map" and emplyees can ­search a radius

I need the jobs to be available for a we­ek only and if its not finalised by then­ the job will expire and gets invisible ­of the main jobs menu but remains in the­ poster's account until deleted or react­ivated. Employers can delete or modify t­he job at anytime but not after the job ­has been accepted by him and the employe­e.

It will show how many workers are trying­ to win the job and workers can ask the ­employer questions about the job in publ­ic so others can see his comments about ­the job.

Emploees can see the jobs that they bid ­on in a section called "My Side jobs lis­t" and if they won it or not and at the­ same time employers can see a list of e­mployees trying to win the job so that t­he can choose the best one for the job.

Each employee and employer will have a s­ection in his profile where others can p­ost a review on him/her and give the a 5­ star rate. And he/she can reply to the review.
Customers will not be allowed to post e­mail addresses or links to websites and ­if someone breach the rules they will ge­t banned from the app.

I need the app to work on all mobile pho­nes and tablets. No website necessary.

comment:
Hi,
I am looking for to create an location based marketplace android app. Initially an MVP is required and later it must be scaled up to meet the growth.

I would like to know the approximate price of this project.

Here are the features :

Seller :
1. Update the product details including price daily.
2. The product will be made only if the user places the order before 2 hours. that being said, no new order should be taken after specific time.
3. Issues the orders placed by the buyer. 
4. Notify the buyer after the product is made.

Product is handed over to the Buyer.

Buyer :

1. Product category wise list based on his near by locations
2. Price listing,comparison and rating of seller
3. Ability to place order and pay online using in-app payment gateway.
4. Gets notification from seller after the product is completed

Goes to the location and receives the product.

The important thing to consider here is, everything works within a certain range i.e location. Buyer should be able to see the exact location and distance of the seller to place an order.

Thank you.

name: Josh
comment:
A backend application, mutli layered, with IOS and Android APP
The mobile application will received a Handshake from a Bluetooth Low Energy Beacon device
The app will connect to backend application, search the DB for the device ID and determine based on the ID and proximity settings what information to send back to the mobile app that's the very basic Idea
The information collected from the beacons and user profiles should be stored in a DB where we can run analytics and reports to determine user shopping patterns and movement
The backend platform will enable the retailers to upload offers, loyalty cards and send out notifications to consumers which are in the proximity of the BLE devices
The Mobile App will provide hyper-local positioning for the retailers inside the shopping center, identify when they arrive to the mall and when their free parking is about to expire, and can use the maps and data collected to create heat maps. 
The backend platform will cater, for retail stores and cafes/restaurants and will have a payment gateway should the retailers/or restaurants allow customers to order from the uploaded menu on the app, with the ability to locate where customers are sitting within the restaurant based on beacon proximity on tables.

name: Dmitriy Prokhnevskiy
comment:
My name is Dmitiry and I'm a graphic designer from Columbus, Ohio. I have a mobile application idea that I want to bring to life. I'm wondering if you are able to help.
 
About the App:

I want to create an application in which a user can create a personal profile and/or be able to link up to facebook or google+. The user will then select a city out of a list of available cities. Upon selection, the user will be able to select a few options to view:
 
- A button that will lead to a list of certain businesses (all lists will be provided by me) whose locations are linked up to an imbedded Google Map. Also, a list of food recipes. Users should be able to rate and comment on both.

- A button that will lead to a provided list of nonprofit organization whose locations are also linked up to an imbedded Google Map, but no rating or commenting ability in needed.

- A button that will lead to an interactive community announcement board where users can post and view events. If possible, it would be nice if users would be able to click "yes" or "no" on each created event so that everyone can see how many people will attend. 

- A button that will lead to a provided list of places users can visit in the city. Each place must be linked up on an imbedded Google Map and should allow users to rate and comment on each place.

- A button that will lead to a section where I can post business advertisement graphics that users can click on and be taken to an internal information page within the app.

- An personal inbox for each user that will allow me to send them privet messages.

- A button that will take users to my website.
 
As I mentioned, I am a graphic designer and I would like to design all of the visuals of the application. I am only in need of coding. Also, if you have an already preexisting platform that is somewhat similar to what I want to accomplish, please let me know. I may be willing to deviate a little from my outline if it lowers cost and creates a better experience for the users.
 
I would like this to be made for both iOS and Android. However, I may need to do one at a time depending on the cost.
 
Thank you,
 
Dmitriy Prokhnevskiy
